definition: (of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The enemy that garrisoned the city surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 鎮守這座城市的敵軍投降了。

sentences.english: Paolo Maldini was moved from left-back to the heart of the defence, alongside Filippo Galli.
sentences.chinese: 馬爾蒂尼從左後衛移到中路，與加利一起鎮守後防。

definition: Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
